newsitem.title: USA: CBOT wheat seen steady down two cents on exports.
newsitem.headline: CBOT wheat seen steady down two cents on exports.

text.p: CBOT wheat futures were expected to open steady to two cents lower on lower-than-expected weekly export sales, traders said.
"That export number is not going to do anything for wheat," said a floor trader.
USDA put weekly export sales at 176,200 tonnes. That figure was a touch below trade expectations for 200,000 to 300,000 tonnes.
Support could stem from ideas that the Kansas hard red winter wheat crop will only have sub-par yields because of freeze damage, traders said.
Choppy trade is also seen as traders begin to take positions in front of USDA's winter wheat production report on Monday.
